attributes.action: Force tobacco companies to make their cigarettes from biodegradable materials.
attributes.additional_details: In Brussels, on the 21st of April 2019, volunteers collected approximately 270,000 cigarette butts in just 3 hours. If that many cigarette butts can be found in a single city, how many could be found in all the oceans of our world?
attributes.background:
Cigarette butts are arguably the number one polluter of our oceans.

This is a petiton to bring in new legislation, forcing tobacco companies to manufacture their cigarettes using biodegradable materials only.
